inventory package¶

Submodules¶

inventory.models module¶

class inventory.models.Goods(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Database model representing goods in the inventory.

id¶

Primary key for the item.

Type:

int

name¶

Name of the item.

Type:

str

category¶

Category of the item (e.g., food, clothes, electronics).

Type:

str

price_per_item¶

Price per item.

Type:

float

description¶

Description of the item (optional).

Type:

str

count_in_stock¶

Count of available items in stock.

Type:

int

add_stock(quantity)[source]¶

Increase the stock of the item.

count_in_stock¶
deduct_stock(quantity)[source]¶

Decrease the stock of the item.

query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Convert a Goods object to a dictionary.

inventory.routes module¶

inventory.routes.add_goods()[source]¶

API to add new goods to the inventory.

Expects: - name (str): Name of the goods. - category (str): Category of the goods. - price_per_item (float): Price per item. - description (str, optional): Description of the goods. - count_in_stock (int): Number of items in stock.

Returns:

JSON response with the created goods details.

inventory.routes.deduct_goods(goods_id)[source]¶

API to deduct a specific quantity of goods from the inventory.

Parameters:

goods_id (int) – ID of the goods.

Expects: - quantity (int): Number of items to deduct.

Returns:

JSON response with the updated goods details.

inventory.routes.get_all_goods()[source]¶

API to retrieve all goods from the inventory.

Returns:

JSON response with a list of all goods.

inventory.routes.get_goods(goods_id)[source]¶

API to retrieve goods by ID.

Parameters:

goods_id (int) – ID of the goods.

Returns:

JSON response with the goods details.

inventory.routes.update_goods(goods_id)[source]¶

API to update fields of a specific goods item.

Parameters:

goods_id (int) – ID of the goods to update.

Expects a JSON payload with the fields to update.

Returns:

JSON response with the updated goods details.
